perturbation.original_text: Within [***] days after the conclusion of each Calendar Quarter to occur during the Term, commencing with the First Commercial Sale of the Product in the Field in the Territory, MMT shall deliver to SIGA a written report containing the following information (each a “Quarterly Report”): [***]. All such reports shall be considered Confidential Information of MMT. Concurrent with the delivery of the applicable Quarterly Report, MMT shall pay to SIGA in Dollars by wire transfer of immediately available funds into an account designated by SIGA in writing in advance of such payment the net result of Quarterly Collected Revenues, minus the corresponding Promotion Fee, and minus any applicable Credit Amount for such Calendar Quarter (all amounts as calculated in the Quarterly Report, and the payment of the net result being a “Quarterly Payment”).
perturbation.changed_text: Within [***] days after the conclusion of each Calendar Quarter to occur during the Term, commencing with the First Commercial Sale of the Product in the Field in the Territory, MMT shall deliver to SIGA a written report containing the following information (each a “Quarterly Report”): [***]. All such reports shall be considered Confidential Information of MMT. However, MMT is not obligated to deliver the Quarterly Report to SIGA if there are no Quarterly Collected Revenues. Concurrent with the delivery of the applicable Quarterly Report, MMT shall pay to SIGA in Dollars by wire transfer of immediately available funds into an account designated by SIGA in writing in advance of such payment the net result of Quarterly Collected Revenues, minus the corresponding Promotion Fee, and minus any applicable Credit Amount for such Calendar Quarter (all amounts as calculated in the Quarterly Report, and the payment of the net result being a “Quarterly Payment”).
perturbation.explanation: This perturbation introduces an in-text contradiction regarding MMT's obligation to provide a Quarterly Report. The original text states that MMT 'shall' deliver the report within [***] days after each quarter. The modified text adds a clause stating that MMT is not obligated to deliver the report if there are no Quarterly Collected Revenues. This creates ambiguity. Is the report due regardless, even if it shows no revenue, or is it only due when there is revenue to report? This could lead to disputes if SIGA expects a report even with no revenue.

perturbation.original_text: Upon the expiration or termination of this Agreement, MMT shall submit a final written report covering the time period between the date of the last Quarterly Report submitted by MMT and the date of expiration or termination of this Agreement (the “Final Report”). The Final Report shall contain all information required to be included in a Quarterly Report with respect to the time period between the conclusion of the most recent Calendar Quarter and the date of expiration or termination of this Agreement. If MMT owes any outstanding amounts to SIGA as calculated pursuant to such Final Report, then MMT shall pay to SIGA in Dollars such outstanding amounts by wire transfer of immediately available funds into an account designated by SIGA in writing in advance of such payment within [***] days after delivery of the Final Report. If SIGA owes any amounts relating to any portion of any outstanding Credit Amounts or otherwise, then SIGA shall pay such outstanding amounts to MMT within [***] days after delivery of the Final Report.
perturbation.changed_text: Upon the expiration or termination of this Agreement, MMT shall submit a final written report covering the time period between the date of the last Quarterly Report submitted by MMT and the date of expiration or termination of this Agreement (the “Final Report”). MMT is not obligated to deliver the Final Report if no First Commercial Sale has occurred. The Final Report shall contain all information required to be included in a Quarterly Report with respect to the time period between the conclusion of the most recent Calendar Quarter and the date of expiration or termination of this Agreement. If MMT owes any outstanding amounts to SIGA as calculated pursuant to such Final Report, then MMT shall pay to SIGA in Dollars such outstanding amounts by wire transfer of immediately available funds into an account designated by SIGA in writing in advance of such payment within [***] days after delivery of the Final Report. If SIGA owes any amounts relating to any portion of any outstanding Credit Amounts or otherwise, then SIGA shall pay such outstanding amounts to MMT within [***] days after delivery of the Final Report.
perturbation.explanation: Here, the contradiction concerns the delivery of the Final Report. The original text mandates MMT 'shall' submit a Final Report. The modified text adds a sentence stating that MMT is not obligated to deliver the Final Report if no First Commercial Sale has occurred. This leads to uncertainty. Does MMT always have to provide a report, or is the report conditional on a commercial sale happening? SIGA might expect a report even without a commercial sale, to document any activity, creating conflict.

perturbation.original_text: SIGA may have an independent top four certified public accountant, reasonably acceptable to MMT (“SIGA’s Auditor”), have access during normal business hours, and upon [***] Business Days’ prior written notice, to examine only those records of MMT (and its Affiliates and sublicensees) as may be reasonably necessary to determine, with respect to any Calendar Year ending not more than [***] before SIGA’s request, the correctness or completeness of any report or payment made under this Agreement; provided, however, MMT shall not be required to provide, and neither SIGA nor SIGA’s Auditor shall be entitled to review, the tax returns or tax records of MMT or those of its Affiliates and sublicensees. The foregoing right of review may be exercised only once per year and only once with respect to each periodic report and payment delivered in accordance with Section 6.2. Reports of the results of any such examination (each an “Audit Report”) will be (a) limited to details of any discrepancies in MMT’s records relating to the Product together with an explanation of the discrepancy and the circumstances giving rise to the discrepancy (b) made available to both Parties and (c) subject to ARTICLE 10. An Audit Report shall become final and binding on the Parties thirty (30) days following MMT’s receipt thereof, unless MMT delivers written notice of its agreement thereto (in which case such Audit Report shall become final and binding on the date of delivery of such notice of agreement) or written notice of its disagreement thereto (“Notice of Disagreement”) to SIGA in either case on or prior to such date.
perturbation.changed_text: SIGA may have an independent top four certified public accountant, reasonably acceptable to MMT (“SIGA’s Auditor”), have access during normal business hours, and upon [***] Business Days’ prior written notice, to examine all records of MMT (and its Affiliates and sublicensees). SIGA is not limited in the scope of records they can review. The audit can cover any time period. MMT shall not be required to provide, and neither SIGA nor SIGA’s Auditor shall be entitled to review, the tax returns or tax records of MMT or those of its Affiliates and sublicensees. The foregoing right of review may be exercised only once per year and only once with respect to each periodic report and payment delivered in accordance with Section 6.2. Reports of the results of any such examination (each an “Audit Report”) will be (a) limited to details of any discrepancies in MMT’s records relating to the Product together with an explanation of the discrepancy and the circumstances giving rise to the discrepancy (b) made available to both Parties and (c) subject to ARTICLE 10. An Audit Report shall become final and binding on the Parties thirty (30) days following MMT’s receipt thereof, unless MMT delivers written notice of its agreement thereto (in which case such Audit Report shall become final and binding on the date of delivery of such notice of agreement) or written notice of its disagreement thereto (“Notice of Disagreement”) to SIGA in either case on or prior to such date.
perturbation.explanation: The original text limits SIGA's auditor's access to records 'as may be reasonably necessary' and restricts the audit to calendar years ending not more than [***] before SIGA's request. The modified text removes these limitations, then adds a sentence that the audit can cover any time period. This creates a contradiction because the original text limits the scope of the audit, while the modified text expands it significantly. MMT could dispute the validity of any audit that exceeds the original scope outlined in the agreement.
